1.text: Start with 1 cup (150 g) of all-purpose flour.

2.text: Add 1½ teaspoons (6 g) of fresh baking powder.

3.text: Add ¼ to ½ teaspoon (1.4-2.8 g) of salt.

4.text: Include ¼ teaspoon (1.25 g) of baking soda if your recipe calls for buttermilk, cocoa, or yogurt.

5.text: Sift the ingredients together to make sure they are evenly combined.

6.text: Use the flour in your recipe.

7.text: Store any leftover flour in an airtight container, and write the expiration date.

8.text: Combine the flours in a large mixing bowl.

11.text: Sift the rising agent into the flour.

12.text: Use the flour in your recipe, and store any leftover flour in an airtight container.
